Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall host a web-based Wiki Service that allows authenticated users to create, edit, and version rich-text pages.
The IDE shall integrate the Planning and Collaboration capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authentication (SSO).
The IDE shall integrate the Planning and Collaboration capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Logging.
The IDE shall maintain a database of work items (e.g., user stories, tasks) including status, assignee, and priority attributes.
The IDE shall transmit real-time text messages between authenticated users via 1-to-1 and group channels.
The IDE shall render a multi-user graphical canvas that supports simultaneous, real-time editing of freeform diagrams.
The IDE shall integrate the Planning and Collaboration capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authorization (RBAC).
The IDE shall integrate the Planning and Collaboration capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Monitoring.
The IDE shall manage hierarchical system requirements objects and their associated attributes (e.g., rationale, verification method)
The IDE shall integrate the System Engineering capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authentication (SSO).
The IDE shall integrate the System Engineering capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Logging.
The IDE Secure Platform shall execute System Engineering client applications within the Remote Application Access Service environment.
The IDE shall provide a modeling environment compliant with the SysML v1.6 (or later) standard for system architecture definition.
The IDE shall execute physics-based or logic-based mission simulations defined by user-provided models.
The IDE shall calculate mission performance parameters based on user-defined analysis models.
The IDE shall integrate the System Engineering capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authorization (RBAC).
The IDE shall integrate the System Engineering capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Monitoring.
The IDE shall manage source code versioning and change history using a distributed version control system.
The IDE shall integrate the Software Factory capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authentication (SSO).
The IDE shall integrate the Software Factory capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Logging.
The IDE shall provide an Integrated Development Environment  that supports source code syntax highlighting and debugger attachment.
The IDE shall provide the 'Remote Application Access Service' for non-web based client Integrated Development Environments.
The IDE shall provide the ability to store and retrieve immutable binary artifacts (e.g., containers, JARs) with cryptographic integrity verification.
The IDE shall provide an automated execution engine for building software upon code commit (CI).
The IDE shall provide an automated engine for deploying artifacts to target environments (CD).
The IDE shall provide tools to perform Static Application Security Testing (SAST) on source code without execution.
The IDE shall provide Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) against running applications.
The IDE shall scan container images for known Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs).
The IDE shall integrate the Software Factory capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authorization (RBAC).
The IDE shall integrate the Software Factory capabilities with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Monitoring.
The IDE shall provide Electrical Computer-Aided Design (ECAD) applications for schematic capture and PCB layout.
The IDE shall integrate the Electrical Engineering capability with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authentication (SSO).

Level 3 Requirement name: EE Non-Web based Client Remote Access
Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall provide the 'Remote Application Access Service' for all Electrical Engineering non-web based 'traditional' applications.
The IDE shall integrate the Electrical Engineering capability with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authorization (RBAC).
The IDE shall provide Mechanical Computer-Aided Design (MCAD) applications for 3D modeling and assembly design.
The IDE shall integrate the Mechanical Engineering capability with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authentication (SSO).

Level 3 Requirement name: ME Non-Web Based Client Remote Access
Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall provide the 'Remote Application Access Service' for all Mechanical Engineering non-web based 'traditional' applications.
The IDE shall integrate the Mechanical Engineering capability with the Mandated Shared Service for Centralized Authorization (RBAC).
The IDE shall provide a capability to collect, summarize, and review user feedback regarding product configurations and performance via a dedicated web interface.
The IDE shall map data elements from connected Authoritative Sources of Truth (ASoTs) to a unified Digital Thread ontology.
The IDE shall extract data relationships from configured ASoTs and persist them as edges within the GraphRAG Database.
The IDE Digital Thread component shall synchronize data changes between connected ASoTs upon user initiated trigger.
The IDE shall provide the ability to query and retrieve relationships between disparate data objects in the Digital Thread.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Logging and Monitoring' service as a consolidated pipeline for all platform logs.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Health Dashboard' to display real-time health status, performance metrics, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of all platform components.
The IDE shall provide a 'Local Security Dashboard' to allow the Local Program Cyber Engineer to review compliance status.
The IDE shall provide a 'Log Bundler Script' that collects platform logs required for L3 support escalation.
The IDE shall provide a 'Consolidated Admin Interface' as a secure, web-based UI to provide a single pane of glass for L1/L2 administrative tasks.
The 'Consolidated Admin Interface' shall provide a module for managing user accounts.
The 'Consolidated Admin Interface' shall provide an administrative GUI for the 'Centralized Secrets Management' service.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Logging and Monitoring' service as a consolidated pipeline for all application logs.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Logging and Monitoring' service as a consolidated pipeline for all health metrics.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Logging and Monitoring' service as a consolidated pipeline for all performance metrics.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Logging and Monitoring' service as a consolidated pipeline for all security audit events.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Health Dashboard' to display real-time performance status of all platform components.
The IDE shall provide a 'Centralized Health Dashboard' to display real-time compliance status of all platform components.
The IDE shall provide a 'Local Security Dashboard' to allow the Local Program Cyber Engineer to review security audit logs.
The IDE shall provide a 'Log Bundler Script' that collects application logs required for L3 support escalation.
The 'Log Bundler Script' shall scrub sensitive data from the collected logs.
The 'Log Bundler Script' shall package the collected logs for L3 support escalation.
The 'Consolidated Admin Interface' shall provide a module for managing user roles.
The 'Consolidated Admin Interface' shall provide a module for managing platform-level access permissions.
The IDE shall generate custom dashboard templates based on user-selected metrics and layout configurations.
The IDE shall provide documentation and resources to assist users in configuring and interpreting dashboards.
The IDE shall enable dashboard user interaction (e.g., drill-down, filtering) to perform detailed analysis.
The IDE Vector Database shall ingest and index unstructured text data tagged as 'Customer Data' for semantic retrieval.
The IDE shall provide a 'Session Memory / History' cache for each user and agent to maintain conversational context during an interaction.
The IDE shall provide a 'Vector Database' capability to index ingested unstructured 'Customer Data' to provide context for AI Agents.
The IDE shall provide a 'Chatbot' capability to provide a general-purpose generative AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) interface for end-users.
The IDE shall provide an 'Agentic Loop (Cognitive Engine)' that enables AI agents to decompose user goals into multi-step plans.
The IDE shall provide a 'Developer Agent' persona integrated with the Software Factory (SWF) to assist with code generation.
The IDE shall provide an 'Insights Agent' persona to perform complex, cross-domain queries of the Digital Thread (GraphRAG) and generate status reports.
The IDE shall provide an 'IT Infrastructure Agent (AIOps)' persona integrated with the Centralized Logging service to perform autonomous root cause analysis.
The IDE shall provide a customer-configurable 'AI Tool Catalog' that defines the specific actions an AI agent is permitted to execute.
The IDE shall provide a 'Local LLM Catalog' capability to enable AI agent operation in air-gapped environments using self-hosted, containerized Large Language Models.
The IDE Network Policy shall block all outbound traffic from AI Agent pods except traffic destined for the AI Gateway.
The 'AI Gateway' shall create a non-repudiable audit log of all AI agent prompts for security and compliance review.
The IDE shall assign each AI agent a distinct, non-human identity (service account) with a unique, role-based access control (RBAC) profile.
The IDE shall ensure no AI agent identity has standing privileged access to the platform or its tool APIs.
The IDE shall suspend AI Agent execution when a generated plan requires privileged tools.
The IDE shall resume suspended AI Agent execution only upon receipt of a cryptographic approval token from a Local Admin.
The IDE Version Control System shall prevent direct commits of Agent-generated code to protected branches.
The IDE shall ensure agent-generated code cannot be merged to a protected branch until it has passed all required DevSecOps pipeline security scans.
The 'Agentic Loop (Cognitive Engine)' shall evaluate multi-step plans for safety.
The 'Agentic Loop (Cognitive Engine)' shall evaluate multi-step plans for correctness.
The 'Agentic Loop (Cognitive Engine)' shall execute approved multi-step plans.
The 'Developer Agent' persona shall assist with natural-language-based debugging.
The 'Developer Agent' persona shall assist with automated unit test script generation.
The 'IT Infrastructure Agent (AIOps)' persona shall generate planned remediation steps.
The 'AI Gateway' shall create a non-repudiable audit log of all AI agent plans for security and compliance review.
The 'AI Gateway' shall create a non-repudiable audit log of all AI agent responses for security and compliance review.
The IDE shall provide a Kubernetes (K8s) orchestrator as the foundational platform for all containerized services and applications.
The IDE platform shall be environment-agnostic, supporting deployment in on-premises, private cloud, public cloud, and fully air-gapped networks.
The IDE platform shall support automated deployment on a specified K8s distribution (e.g., Linux OpenShift) for both bare metal and hypervisor-based on-premises environments.
The IDE platform shall support automated deployment on specified managed Kubernetes services (e.g., EKS, OpenShift) on cloud environments.
The IDE installation process shall provision a new, dedicated K8s cluster and shall not deploy into a pre-existing, non-IDE K8s cluster.
The IDE shall provide a mandated shared service for Centralized Authentication and Authorization (SSO) that functions as an identity broker, connecting to a customer-provided Identity Provider (IdP).
The IDE shall provide a mandated shared service for 'In-Cluster VM Management' to orchestrate non-containerized workloads as virtual machines within the cluster.
The IDE shall provide a mandated shared service for 'Remote Application Access' to provide on-demand, streaming access to non-web based 'traditional'  applications via an end-user's web browser.
The mandated shared service for 'Remote Application Access' shall render at minimum 30 frames per second with less than 100ms input latency.
The IDE shall provide a mandated shared 'Service Mesh' that provides service discovery.
The IDE shall provide a mandated shared service for 'Backup and Recovery' that performs automated, policy-based backups of the platform state and customer data.
The IDE shall provide a 'full IDE System Restore' capability to restore the platform from an automated backup, as defined in Scenario 5.4.3.
The IDE Secure Platform shall instantiate customer-provided container images upon validation of the deployment manifest.
The IDE Secure Platform shall enable 'Customer-Integrated Applications' to leverage Mandated Shared Services via adherence to the published IDE Interface Control Document (ICD).

The IDE shall include a formal, version-controlled Interface Control Document (ICD) as a core product deliverable that defines the technical and security 'contract' for integrating customer applications.
The IDE shall provide a mandated shared service for 'Centralized Secrets Management' to support the secure storage of platform and application credentials.
The IDE shall integrate all 'Centralized Secrets Management' access and management actions with the 'Centralized Logging' service to ensure all actions are auditable.

The IDE Interface Control Document (ICD) shall define the programmatic API for the 'Centralized Secrets Management' service to enable 'Customer-Integrated Applications' to securely access credentials.
The mandated shared 'Service Mesh' shall provide policy-driven traffic management.
The mandated shared 'Service Mesh' shall enforce zero-trust security via mutually authenticated mTLS for all service-to-service communication.
The mandated shared service for 'Centralized Secrets Management' shall support the secure distribution of platform and application credentials.
The mandated shared service for 'Centralized Secrets Management' shall support the secure rotation of platform and application credentials.
The IDE 'Secure Platform' and 'IDE Capability Layer' components shall be hardened to comply with NIST SP 800-53 (Rev 5).
The IDE baseline shall be maintained under a formal Continuous Authorization to Operate (cATO) process, enabled by a provider-side DevSecOps pipeline and customer-side Continuous Monitoring (CONMON).
The IDE shall provide a 'Cyber compliance evidence' package (Body of Evidence) to support customer ATO inheritance.
The IDE shall be delivered as a complete, 'opinionated stack'; deployment of the 'IDE Capability Layer' on a non-IDE platform shall not be supported.

The IDE shall provide tools (e.g., Health Dashboard) to detect and report when an IDE Instance has been modified outside of 'IDE provided admin tools', which moves the instance to an 'unsupported' state.
The 'Centralized Secrets Management' service shall encrypt secrets at rest and in transit using FIPS-approved algorithms.
The IDE Factory shall generate a machine-readable Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) in SPDX or CycloneDX format for every deployment package.
The 'Cyber compliance evidence' package shall include security scan results (SAST, DAST, container scans).
The 'Cyber compliance evidence' package shall include the baseline System Security Plan (SSP) and control mappings.
The IDE 'Secure Platform' and 'IDE Capability Layer' components shall be configured to comply with NIST SP 800-53 (Rev 5).
The IDE 'Secure Platform' and 'IDE Capability Layer' components shall be hardened to comply with NIST SP 800-171 controls.
The IDE 'Secure Platform' and 'IDE Capability Layer' components shall be configured to comply with NIST SP 800-171 controls.
The IDE shall complete the 'Day 0 Provisioning' scenario (Scenario 5.1.1), from execution of the bootstrap command to operational readiness, in less than four (4) hours.
The IDE shall complete the 'Platform Patching and Upgrades' scenario (Scenario 5.2.2), from execution of the upgrade command to operational readiness, in under one (1) hour.
The IDE 'Secure Platform' and its 'Mandated Shared Services' shall provide >= 99.99% availability.
The 'Backup and Recovery' service shall provide an automated backup policy targeting a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of <= 24 hours for all 'Customer Data' in platform-managed persistent volumes.

The IDE shall provide a 'full IDE System Restore' capability that meets a Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of <= 4 hours (TBR), contingent on customer-provisioned infrastructure meeting mininum infrastructure requirements.
The IDE (via the IDE Factory) shall produce and publish a validated 'upgrade package' in response to a critical CVE within 48 hours of public disclosure.
The IDE shall provide a 'destroy IDE script' to securely remove an IDE instance and all associated resources.
The IDE 'destroy IDE script' shall generate a 'Data Destruction Certificate' (audit log) of all destruction activities and component erasure status.
The IDE shall include documented guidance for the 'destroy IDE script' as part of the core product deliverable.
The 'destroy IDE script' shall perform cryptographic erasure of all associated persistent volumes.
The IDE Secure Platform shall provide a mandated shared service for structured data storage (e.g., SQL-compatible).
The IDE Secure Platform shall provide a mandated shared service for unstructured data storage (e.g., object storage).
The IDE Factory shall provide a web-based 'Configuration Portal' for customers to configure and procure new IDE Instances and updates.
The 'Configuration Portal' shall allow a customer to select their target K8s variant.
The IDE Factory shall calculate and display the minimum CPU, RAM, and Storage resources required for the selected configuration.
The IDE Factory shall provide a 'Package Builder' service that generates a 'site deployment package' based on a validated customer configuration.
The IDE Factory shall automatically generate a 'Cyber compliance evidence' package for each 'site deployment package'.
The IDE Factory shall maintain a 'Configuration Database' as the authoritative source for all package configurations, metadata, and SBOMs.
The IDE Factory shall publish the final, signed 'site deployment package' to an 'Enterprise Repository' for customer download.
The 'Configuration Portal' shall allow a customer to add 'IDE Capabilities' to their deployment package.
The 'Configuration Portal' shall allow a customer to remove 'IDE Capabilities' from their deployment package.
The 'Configuration Portal' shall allow a customer to add 'AI Capability' to their deployment package.
The 'Configuration Portal' shall allow a customer to remove 'AI Capability' from their deployment package.
The IDE Factory shall publish the final, signed 'Cyber compliance evidence' to an 'Enterprise Repository' for customer download.
The IDE Factory shall provide a web-based 'Customer Service Portal' for customers to submit feedback and support tickets.
The 'Configuration Portal' shall provide a user-friendly interface for environment setup, configuration, and deployment of IDE instances.
The 'site deployment package' shall be a comprehensive, self-contained offline package suitable for air-gapped environment deployment.
The 'site deployment package' shall include the Secure Platform (SP) binaries.
The 'site deployment package' shall include the IDE Capability 'gold' container images.
The 'site deployment package' shall include the installation and update scripts.
The 'site deployment package' shall include the post-installation test scripts.
The 'site deployment package' shall include user and administrator documentation.
The 'site deployment package' shall include the 'Cyber Compliance Evidence'.
The 'site deployment package' shall include the 'Local Admin Tools'.
The IDE shall provide a 'pre-validation' tool to inspect source (legacy) environments to evaluate migration effects on systems, applications, and data integrity.
The IDE shall provide an 'IDE Migration Utility' with a guided interface to connect to a backup source.
The IDE shall provide post-migration validation tools to ensure all systems and applications are functioning as expected and no data loss has occurred.
The IDE shall maintain auditable logs, ingested by the 'Centralized Logging' service, of all migration and upgrade activities.
The IDE shall provide a 'pre-validation' tool to inspect destination (IDE) environments to evaluate migration effects on systems, applications, and data integrity.
The 'IDE Migration Utility' shall provide a guided interface to map legacy data to IDE-hosted applications.
The 'IDE Migration Utility' shall execute the data transfer.
The IDE shall provide post-migration validation checklists to ensure all systems and applications are functioning as expected and no data loss has occurred.
The IDE shall implement data backup procedures to ensure that authoritative data is securely backed up prior to executing the migration or upgrade.
The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Access Control (AC) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.1.2 Centralized AuthN/AuthZ, Sec 2.1.2 Service Mesh, Sec 2.3.2 AI Gateway

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Audit & Accountability (AU) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.1.2 Centralized Logging, Sec 2.3.2 AI Gateway, Sec 4.4.1 AI Gateway as PEP

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Identification & Authentication (IA) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Configuration Management (CM) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.4 The IDE Factory, Sec 2.1.2 Monitoring, Sec 4.1 Compliant-by-Default

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Contingency Planning (CP) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.1.2 Backup and Recovery, Sec 5.4.3 Disaster Recovery

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Maintenance (MA) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 3.3.3 Local Admin Tooling, Sec 5.2.2 Platform Patching

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the Media Protection (MP) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the System & Communications Protection (SC) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.1.2 Service Mesh, Sec 2.1.2 Centralized Secrets Management

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall implement the system-level controls for the System & Information Integrity (SI) family as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.1.2 Monitoring, Sec 2.2 Software Factory (SWF), Sec 4.4.2 Agent-Generated Code

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall provide the technical capabilities and compliance artifacts to enable the Assessment, Authorization, and Monitoring (CA) family, as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 3.3.3 Local Admin Tooling, Sec 4.3.1 Inheritance Package, Sec 2.4.1 Package Content
Notes: L4s detailing the provisioning of the Sec 3.3.3 dashboards (e.g., Local Security Dashboard) and the generation of the Sec 4.3.1 inheritance package (e.g., SBOM, scan results, control mappings).

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall provide the technical capabilities and response procedures to support the Incident Response (IR) family, as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: ec 3.4 IR Shared Responsibility, Sec 3.3.3 Local Admin Tooling, Sec 5.4.1 & 5.4.2
Notes: L4s detailing the tools the IDE provides to the customer (e.g., Sec 3.3.3 dashboards, Sec 5.4.2 log access) and the process the IDE team is responsible for (e.g., Sec 3.4.2 and Sec 5.4.1 IDE-led platform patching).

Level 3 Requirement text: The IDE shall provide the validated packages and administrative tools to support the Maintenance (MA) family, as specified by the target baseline (NIST 800-171 or 800-53 Moderate).
IDE Conops Section References: Sec 2.4 IDE Factory, Sec 3.1 SRM, Sec 5.2.2 Platform Patching
Notes: L4s detailing the IDE's responsibility to create and deliver patches (per Sec 3.1 SRM and Sec 5.2.2) and the tools it provides to the customer to apply them (e.g., the upgrade.sh script, Sec 5.2.2).
